feed.title: Zitnik Lab
feed.subtitle: Harvard Machine Learning for Medicine and Science

entry.title: PocketGen in Nature Machine Intelligence
entry.content: PocketGen is a multimodal sequence-structure generative model for designing full-atom ligand-binding protein pockets.
entry.summary: PocketGen is a multimodal sequence-structure generative model for designing full-atom ligand-binding protein pockets.

entry.title: Biomedical AI Agents in Cell
entry.content: We envision “AI scientists” as AI agents capable of skeptical learning and reasoning that empower biomedical research by integrating ML models and biomedical tools with experimental platforms.
entry.summary: We envision “AI scientists” as AI agents capable of skeptical learning and reasoning that empower biomedical research by integrating ML models and biomedical tools with experimental platforms.

entry.title: Activity Cliffs in Molecular Property Prediction

link.title: Activity Cliffs in Molecular Property Prediction

entry.content: New paper on activity-cliff informed contrastive learning for molecular property prediction.
entry.summary: New paper on activity-cliff informed contrastive learning for molecular property prediction.

entry.title: Knowledge Graph Agent for Medical Reasoning

link.title: Knowledge Graph Agent for Medical Reasoning

entry.content: New paper introducing a knowledge graph agent for complex, knowledge-intensive medical reasoning.
entry.summary: New paper introducing a knowledge graph agent for complex, knowledge-intensive medical reasoning.

entry.title: Three Papers Accepted to NeurIPS
entry.content: Exciting projects include a unified multi-task time series model, a flow-matching approach for generating protein pockets using geometric priors, and a tokenization method that produces invariant molecular representations for integration into large language models.
entry.summary: Exciting projects include a unified multi-task time series model, a flow-matching approach for generating protein pockets using geometric priors, and a tokenization method that produces invariant molecular representations for integration into large language models.

entry.title: TxGNN Published in Nature Medicine
entry.content: Graph foundation model for drug repurposing published in Nature Medicine. [Harvard Gazette] [Harvard Medicine News] [Forbes] [NVIDIA]
entry.summary: Graph foundation model for drug repurposing published in Nature Medicine. [Harvard Gazette] [Harvard Medicine News] [Forbes] [NVIDIA]

entry.title: Graph AI in Medicine
entry.content: Excited to share a new perspective on Graph Artificial Intelligence in Medicine in Annual Reviews.
entry.summary: Excited to share a new perspective on Graph Artificial Intelligence in Medicine in Annual Reviews.

entry.title: How Proteins Behave in Context
entry.content: Harvard Medicine News on our new AI tool that captures how proteins behave in context. Kempner Institute on how context matters for foundation models in biology.
entry.summary: Harvard Medicine News on our new AI tool that captures how proteins behave in context. Kempner Institute on how context matters for foundation models in biology.

entry.title: PINNACLE in Nature Methods
entry.content: PINNACLE contextual AI model is published in Nature Methods. Paper. Research Briefing. Project website.
entry.summary: PINNACLE contextual AI model is published in Nature Methods. Paper. Research Briefing. Project website.

entry.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models of Individuals

link.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models of Individuals

entry.content: Paper on digitial twins outlining strategies to leverage molecular and computational techniques to construct dynamic digital twins on the scale of populations to individuals.
entry.summary: Paper on digitial twins outlining strategies to leverage molecular and computational techniques to construct dynamic digital twins on the scale of populations to individuals.
